Brad Woodhouse: president of the pro-Clinton Super PAC Correct the Record, stated that Hillary Clinton's handling of her emails broke no laws.
Correct the Record: a super PAC created to support Clinton, defended her against questions about her email handling during her presidential campaign.
Woodhouse dismissed the entire email mat: stating that Clinton did what every other federal official did and that the New York Times had to retract their story about laws being broken.
The New York Times public editor: Margaret Sullivan, acknowledged that the article breaking the story was not without fault but clarified that the newspaper did not issue a formal retraction or correction.
